intro: Tephrosia sylviae, commonly known as the purple tephrosia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its pod-bearing fruits and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are bipinnate, and it produces clusters of small, fragrant, purple or pink flowers. Tephrosia sylviae is also valued for its use in traditional medicine and as a source of forage for livestock.
